segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it’s just getting worse and worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing in a puddle, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long this has been going on and why no one has done anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on the cookies that they don’t even see the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole kitchen is going to be ruined if someone doesn’t turn off that faucet soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is streaming down the cabinets, and it’s just going to make everything slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is while the kitchen is flooding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is going to slip and fall if she doesn’t move soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she wakes up and realizes what’s happening before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a mess, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR
